instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.PP1V05_S0:
What is PP1V05_S0? The PP1V05_S0 power rail is for various components on the logic board that require a 1.05V supply voltage in the S0 (on) state. This voltage rail is likely to be used by the CPU (for VCCIO), PCH (Platform Controller Hub).

.
definitions.CPU_VCORE: What is CPU_VCORE? Power rail for the CPU. If this is missing the machine will act braindead. .
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> All voltages present but brain dead - <SIGNAL>MEM_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is low
threads.message:
Hi,

I have that which had only a tiny liquid damage around <RESISTOR>R7521</RESISTOR>.
I have replaced the 4 resistors where the corrosion has formed and replaced also <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>.

Now the board gets voltages but is stuck at .2A
<SIGNAL>CPU_VCORE</SIGNAL> is present as well as <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL>. The PCH die gets warm but the CPU die is cold even though it's getting its 1.7V.

The only clue I have is that <SIGNAL>MEM_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is .1V which I guess is a bad value.
I am not getting the beeping sound for the RAM.

The <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> area is good and all voltages are present including <SIGNAL>PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK</SIGNAL>.

Any idea where I could look?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> All voltages present but brain dead - <SIGNAL>MEM_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is low
threads.message:
Well <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is also low...

That doesn't sound promising!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> All voltages present but brain dead - <SIGNAL>MEM_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is low
threads.message: Did you try known good BIOS?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> All voltages present but brain dead - <SIGNAL>MEM_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is low
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> All voltages present but brain dead - <SIGNAL>MEM_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is low
threads.message:
Actually can you provide a BIOS with a clean ME region please?

I have fixed the issue and the board is booting up now but the loading bar reaches the end and get stuck there.
I can confirm it's a motherboard issue as another board in the same enclosure is booting up just fine.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> All voltages present but brain dead - <SIGNAL>MEM_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is low
threads.message:
Upload your BIOS somewhere.
Didn't find any active link posted for clean BIOS on the forum?
